intro: Spennera pellucida, commonly known as the glassy spennera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, translucent leaves that give it its common name. Spennera pellucida produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
